inn1.comm: slightly back of a length and seaming away outside off - left alone and for good reason
Anderson pitches tighter to the off stump, again a hint of away movement and there's decent bounce and carry as Guptill shoulders arms
line and length outside off stump, gets across to cover off stump, leaves it alone

that's an absolute snorter from Anderson! Full of a length, angling towards middle, pitching on off and then holding its line to beat the edge as Guptill tries to turn the ball through midwicket. It was only an inch or two from hitting the top of off as well
length ball, strays down the leg side and that's another wide
swish and a miss from Guptill, slightly nervy start, throwing the bat at a wide one, nothing on it though
that will settle him, closer to off stump and rising, Guptill plays back and punches square through the off side, plenty of bat on it and the ball races away
length and coming back in this time, goes across and raises his bat out of the way
slightly back of a length, speared in and there's no seam movement, heads down the leg side for a wide
in the channel outside off, Ronchi gets forward and lets it through
this is shortish and over the top of off, coming back in and cramping Ronchi, who blocks
another delivery seaming in, clouts Ronchi on his protective gear as the bat scissors down at an angle
back of a length and rising sharply in the channel outside off stump, left alone
at the body, short of a length and jabbed towards square leg from the crease
sloppy fielding from Morgan gifts Ronchi his first runs as a New Zealand international, guiding one off the back foot towards point and the ball bobbles through the hands
perhaps lucky not to be called wide here, jagging away off the pitch and over the tramlines as Guptill watches it by
tighter, in the corridor of disquietude, another watchful leave
pitched up outside off stump, Guptill crunches a drive straight at mid-off ... and another misfield gifts New Zealand three more runs
in and out, good line outside off, left alone
pitched on a length in the channel, straightens a little and Ronchi leaves

this one doesn't leave the batsman but Ronchi realises too late and is castled, top of off stump! This is exemplary stuff from Anderson, setting up Ronchi, who knows he's back in international cricket now... Two had shaped away outside off, this went on with Anderson's arm, whip-crack fast and straight through the batsman's defence, a big gap between bat and pad
length ball outside off, Guptill stands tall and plays out towards point
short and at the batsman, tapped defensively into the leg side
good off-stump line, gets across and defends from the crease
again the batsman covers his off stump and blocks a short-of-a-length ball from the crease
pitched up a little further, on drive, punched on the half volley towards mid-on, where it's grabbed this time
shortish and tight around the off stump, defended solidly on the back foot - maiden from Brezzie lad
back of a length, angling back in from outside off, chops down defensively
bit more width, Williamson stays back and steers the ball to point
this one nearly sneaks through, little deviation back off the pitch and it clips Williamson's inside edge before plopping behind the flap of his pad
pitched up again and ducking back as the batsman walks across his stumps, another inside edge this time into the front leg and rolling short on the leg side
good footwork from Williamson, gets to the pitch outside off and neatly punches through a gap in the covers for three
good length, around the top of off, defended solidly back down the track
length ball, wide of the stumps and carved off the back foot wide of third man for a couple
slightly fuller, seaming back in and beats Williamson on the inside, hitting the thigh pad
angled in towards the stumps, shuffles across and taps to leg
superbly timed from Williamson, just a nudge off the front pad and the ball takes off like a labrador after a butterfly, bouncing exuberantly across the outfield wide of mid-on
bit of width outside off stump and cut behind point for a single
more good timing from Guptill, waiting on a slightly short delivery outside off and forcing a back-foot drive in front of square, Morgan just pulling it in before the rope
coming in, off a length, worked off the pads from in front of the wicket
goes back to a length ball outside off and chops into the covers
defended from the crease, maybe stays a touch low and hits near the toe of the bat
angling in towards middle and off, clipped square and they nick a quick one
fullish length around off stump, already the ball has gone a bit quiet, defended on the front foot
another solid forward defensive meets a length ball outside off, they shake hands, exchange pleasantries and continue on their way
gets across his stumps and blocks a length ball outside off
angling in, good bounce off a length for Bres, jabbed carefully into the ground towards midwicket
beaten on the inside - again maybe stayed down a little? - no foot movement from Guptill and the ball nipped back as he swung hard at it
drops a length ball short on the leg side and they rotate the strike
good length delivery in the channel, shaping back in but Williamson is comfortable leaving
front-foot defensive to a length delivery outside off
around the off stump, fullish and punched towards mid-on
shorter and in the channel outside off, tapped square off the back foot
gets across to defend a full-length ball around off
very full, wide of the stumps, pretty much a half volley and Guptill creams it straight to Graeme Swann standing at short extra cover
on the stumps, edges across and flicks one to fine leg
drops a touch short and Williamson waits, dabs a single through gully with an angled bat
touch short and wide, steered from the crease to the man at point
length ball, on the stumps, worked fine of mid-on for a quick single
slightly short, doesn't quite get up and Guptill is hit on the knee roll trying to play across the line

dropped, a howler from Trott, though it came at him fast! Woakes tried a short ball and Guptill seized on it, connected with a hard pull shot but it was straight at midwicket, bursting through the hands and deflating Woakes just a little further
around off stump, back of a length and Guptill defends this one
and there's further pain for Chris Woakes, too short and straight, pulled with the minimum of fuss in front of square, another solid connection and that's a boundary to end the over
on the stumps, too straight to begin with and clipped firmly between midwicket and mid-on
pitched up outside the line of off stump, punched through the covers, there's a sweeper in place but they get back for two
slides down the leg side for more extras
length ball nudged off the pads through square leg
better line from Dernbach, driven on the up from outside off towards mid-on
length delivery around off stump, Williamson gets forward and defends
length, touch wider, played from back in the crease into the ground out towards point
pitched up around the line of off stump, punched back
drags his length down, over the top of the stumps, Guptill tucks it into the leg side
goes back and across and shows a length ball a straight bat in defence
on the pads, again a touch short and nudged into a gap at midwicket
slides down the leg side, slightly back of length, Guptill misses with a glance but it's called wide
half a chance but Cook's superman effort at mid-on, though worthy of his coloured pajamas, fails to get there as Guptill hits through the line, driving on the up and lofting four to long-off
straight, length delivery, worked through midwicket for another couple
drops short, around middle and off, Williamson hooks and loses his footing in the process, deep square leg has to run round to cut it off
coming back in towards the stumps, played back down the track
pitched up on off stump and driven to mid-on
goes back and taps a short delivery wide of point for a single
decent line, outside off and rising off a good length, Guptill plays it late, opening the face to glide one to third man
and there's the Dernbach slowie, well directed and Williamson picks it, defending stoutly in front of the wicket
on the stumps, clipped through backward square leg
pitched up full and straight, Williamson hammers the bat down through a flicked drive but picks out midwicket
length ball on the stumps, waits and taps one through leg
touch full and straight, lovely on drive, hit on the up and heading for the long-on rope until Dernbach sprawls across its path to pull off a smart stop
line and length outside off, soft hands from Williamson drops the ball short on the off side and they scamper another single
better discipline from Woakes, length ball around off, comes off the outside half of the bat and Morgan fields at point
tossed up on middle and leg stump, tries to work through midwicket but it hits the pad
length ball outside off, Williamson presses forward and then drops back to make room for a cut through point
floated up around leg stump, nudged through square leg for one - that's the fifty partnership between these two
flatter, on off stump, punched off the back foot to long-on
length ball on the stumps, tickled back past the bowler for another single to long-on
goes back to a delivery floated up outside off, steers to backward point
waits on a length ball outside off and dabs short of backward point
short and wide and cracked behind square off the back foot, looks like four written all over it but Root slides on his belly round the rope wide of third man and saves a couple
pitched up in the channel, brings the bat down late and squeezes it to backward point
wide full toss, Williamson drives but plays slightly outside the line, gets a thin edge which sends it skittering past Buttler for a four in pretty much the opposite direction to where he was aiming
tight around off stump, short of a length and defended down on to the pitch
too straight, length ball whipped off the pads over midwicket, not the cleanest of connections and the man in the deep gets round
tossed up, turned through the leg side
pushed through a bit flatter outside off stump, Williamson gets forward and pushes into a gap at cover
length delivery outside off, sits back and chops one to the sweeper in the covers
little bit of spin for Root here, the ball jumping back at Williamson as he tries to cut
floated up on the stumps, gets out of the crease and nudges one through midwicket
a touch short again, outside off and this doesn't spin much, forced in front of square off the back foot
full and straight, maybe another slower one, Williamson gets behind it to defend
on the stumps, length ball and turned through backward square
lively bouncer from Dernbach - for all his variations, he's got serious pace - and this zings through as Williamson pulls out of the shot. Questionable on height but Davis seems happy
shortish, around middle and off, blocked into the covers
drops too short and wide, Guptill scythes a cut shot through point but the sweeper cleans up
out the back of the hand but very wide - probably would have been called if Williamson didn't get a scrape of bat on it, the ball runs fine of third man and that's another cheap boundary
short and wide, bit of a loosener and it's duly crunched in front of square, really good connection and the fielder in the deep can't get round
tossed up straighter, gets forward and taps to long-on
pushed through outside off, played back down the track
fiddled towards backward point, not straight to the man and they nick another
waits on the ball and plays with the spin through square leg
flatter, wide of the wicket, Williamson gets forward and blocks into the covers
short of a length and in the channel outside off, stays back and guides to third man
floated up wide of the stumps, nice and drivable, though Williamson is a little lucky that his inside edge flies past the stumps to fine leg
back of a length and worked through the leg side
good effort ball from Dernbach, banged in outside off, defended on the back foot
dug in short again and Williamson takes this on, pulling aerially over midwicket, cries of "catch!" from the bowler but it lands safely
length ball wide of the wicket, again comfortably dabbed to third man for one
pushed through outside off and cut to the sweeper in the deep
tossed up and Guptill punches to long-on for a run that takes him to another pleasant (certainly if you're kiwi) half-century
played back past the bowler to long-on
gets a leading edge this time, trying to play across the line and ball holds its own, squirts through cover point
tossed up and played down the ground
another edge from Guptill, still not entirely convincing against spin, but there's no slip and it skitters away for four
wide of the stumps, allows it to run off the face of the bat to third man

another miscue from Guptill, who's got to fifty and gone to pieces... This time he tries to hook Dernbach, is beaten for pace and the ball loops high off the splice but lands a few feet behind midwicket running back
full of a length and wide of the stumps, Guptill chops into the ground off a bottom edge
pitched up and steered through the covers
full and outside the line of off, driven into a gap - that's the hundred partnership, at just over five an over
short of a length, seaming back a touch and cramping the cut, fielded in the covers
floated up outside off stump and flayed into the covers, a good diving stop keeps them to one
tossed up and Guptill gets a leading edge back to the bowler trying to work to leg
on the stumps, nudged through the leg side
tossed up on middle and off and again played with the spin through midwicket
drops short, pulled flat to the sweeper at deep midwicket
tossed up, edges forward and pushes fine of the sprawling mid-on... fifty for Williamson, who always looks like a million dollars, whatever his average says
pitched up around the line of off, driven to mid-off
touch shorter, angling in and jabbed into the off side
length ball, on the stumps and flicked wristily off the front pad through midwicket for a couple
back of a length and outside off, Guptill punches from the crease to the extra-cover fielder
this is a monstrous shot from Guptill, he pulls it high into the crowd at deep midwicket with a flowing golf swing of the bat - it was barely even a short ball but still got the treatment
this is length again, wide of the stumps and steered down to third man
tossed up and punched wide of mid-off
uses the feet and gets out to a full straight ball, chips down the ground, long-on runs across to cover
floated up wide of the stumps, Williamson skips forward and pinches two into a gap in front of deep cover

tossed up high, under-edged and gone, clattering the timber! Williamson tried to pull hard across the line, possibly a little early on the shot, good variation from Swann, who held it back, little bit of spin and the batsman almost knocked himself over trying to hit the cover off it, instead the bails went BOOM
tossed up on leg stump, clipped to the fielder at backward square leg
length ball on middle and off, tries to whip to leg but can't beat the infield
forward press into the covers from just outside off
fuller and straighter, clipped wide of mid-on for a quick single
back of a length outside off, Taylor gets inside the line and drops the hands
full and just outside off, mid-off is on the edge of the circle so they take an easy single to him
length ball on the stumps, tucked in front of square leg
back of a length around off stump, it gets up on Taylor who jumps up on his toes and he keeps it out up the wicket
tossed up on off stump, clipped down the ground, Swann might have saved that
paddle swept from just outside off, gets it fine of short long leg
just outside off, dabbed to short third man
played forward and gets an inside edge into the pad, it runs up on the off side
overpitched on the stumps, clipped down to long on
a touch shorter in length, tucked with the turn to midwicket
full and a bit of indrift towards off, driven into the covers
more of a length ball just outside off, played with an open face down to third man
foot outside off on a good length, punched to cover
length is a couple of inches shorter, just a block this time again just outside off
whatever you do Mr Woakes, don't bowl here to Ross Taylor, overpitched on the stumps and clipped through midwicket, very well timed
chance to clip off the legs again, runs this through square leg, the fielder scrambles back and takes just two
flat, straight delivery, worked wide of midwicket off a length
more air, taken from off stump to long on
played forward just outside off and blocked back to the bowler
a little straight and tucked out to deep square leg
stays back and takes a ball that goes straight on outside off with a little dab very fine on the off side, it almost runs the rope but Bresnan slides and saves
full ball on the stumps, clipped down to long on
full on the stumps and clipped down to long leg, fine enough to get it to the rope
length outside off, dabbed down to third man staying in the crease
length ball, a little straight, clipped to deep square leg, they run well as the fielder goes to his left and they take two
length again, more towards the off stump and Taylor plays with the angle to midwicket
full length just outside off stump, pushed towards cover point
length ball, tucked down to long leg
full ball on off stump, clipped to short midwicket
off stump, it was the slider, played to cover on the front foot

starts too straight and turns down the leg side, not called wide so Steve Davis has seen some more turn than we've seen so far in the innings, did Cook save this at fine leg? Just saves four I think, apparently not
length ball, played back and pushed down to long on
full ball clipped back to the bowler
a little straighter and clipped to midwicket
full length ball, just outside off stump, dabbed into the covers and they take a quick single
length ball nipped in off the seam, Taylor tries to late cut and got a bottom edge to point, it became a little too close for the shot
length ball on middle and off, dropped into midwicket, they take a sharp single, well ran again
a little straighter, clipped down to long leg, wide of the fielder and they take two
off stump, just back of a length, back foot push to cover
drifts back into the pads and gets tucked down to long leg, again gets it wide of the fielder for a couple
full toss just outside off, slapped down to long on only
makes this land just outside off, tucked with the turn in front of midwicket
stays back to this and plays with the spin behind square on the leg side
length ball on off stump, Taylor stays in the crease and punches down to long on
little fuller and casually flicked with the turn down to long on
better flighted, tucked to midwicket a little unsure in the footwork
length, drifts into the off stump, pushed carefully to point
length just outside off, dabbed down to third man
length ball just outside off, driven slightly on the walk and steers it past cover point to the sweeper
little short and pulled down to long leg
short again and Taylor takes it from outside off through square leg, superbly played, kept it down and steered it into the gap
much fuller and pushed to cover
stays in the crease and flicks to midwicket
tossed up from wider on the bowling crease, worked with the turn wide of Swann's right hand and they take a quick run
a little fuller, flicked to midwicket
wider on the crease again, tucked through square leg, four fielders converge on the ball but they can't prevent two, really well played and ran
full length just outside off, tucked down to long on
straight delivery, flicked between square leg and midwicket
big stride forward to meet a length delivery on off stump, gets it to cover
just outside off, punched to cover coming forward again
length ball just outside off, Guptill stays leg side of it and slaps it to cover, they run to the fielder on the edge of the circle and get home comfortably
length ball around off stump, tucked to cover again, as deep as he's allowed to be
length ball just outside off, tucked into the covers again for an easy run
whoops, hip-high full toss clipped over square leg
full ball on the stumps, driven hard back past the bowler but the stumps intervene, unlucky
short and pulled wide of long on, Guptill to 99
full and driven past the bowler, this evades the stumps and Guptill has back-to-back ODI hundreds, what an effort
slower ball on the stumps, tucked through midwicket
full and a firm straight drive again, ricochets of Dernbach's boot, they take a single into the covers
much better, right up in the block hole, dug out into the covers
length ball on the pads, lucky to only concede one to the 45
wide length ball slapped to the sweeper, lucky to only concede one again
length ball, a tighter line, dabbed down to third man
slower ball, full and straight, clipped down to long on
length ball on the stumps, runs off the pad to square leg
length ball slides into the off stump, played forward into the covers
slower ball, full ball on the stumps, chipped wide of midwicket and again they run hard and get two
full speed, quick on the stumps, dug out and it loops over the bowler's head
goes full and straight again, Guptill meets it on the full and pushes down to long on
slower ball outside off, Taylor goes hard at it and fetches it down towards long on, it doesn't carry to the fielde
full on off stump, carved into the covers, Trott gets down with one hand and saves really well with his right hand
another slower ball but this is too straight and gets flicked out behind square on the leg side, chase back to the backward square fence

umm...no idea. A bouncer outside off stump has looped up and almost bounced again as it reaches Taylor, he leans out and tries to cut it but misses and it goes through to Buttler, very strange, everyone looks a bit bemused
but this is a poor ball, back of a length outside off and hammered backward of point, Taylor goes to fiftty, that is his zone
tighter to off stump and played off the front foot to point
full on the stumps, dug out to long on
slower ball on the stumps, flicked down the ground again
length ball, heaved into the leg side, got it high on the bat so just one to the sweeper
length ball on the stumps, flicked through square leg
little bit more flight, pushed back to the bowler
full on the middle stump, whipped through square leg
quicker ball, right up in the blockhole, dug out into the covers
stays in the crease and punches back to the bowler
you sensed a big shot coming and this is lifted over the bowler's left hand for four, powerful strike, good end to the over for New Zealand
length ball on the stumps, goes to whip it away on the leg side, runs off the pad to short long leg
fuller ball on the stumps, tucked to midwicket on the edge of the circle
full on the stumps again but Taylor gets under this really well and clears the midwicket rope, great timing, just a flick and it sailed over the rope

goes again but this has gone up rather than long and Woakes takes the catch at long leg. That is a fine catch cause it went a long long way up, a top edge from Taylor attempted the same stroke over the leg side
length ball a little too wide and driven past cover, chase for the sweeper and they get two
stays in the crease and dabs a ball from just outside off backward of point
length ball, stays in the crease and flicks behind point, well placed, deep cover point runs to his right to field
same stroke, this time gets it squarer so the sweeper can save the second run
goes reverse-sweeping first ball, gets some glove on it towards backward point does he, nope just off the pad
step down the wicket and a lofted on drive, gets just enough on it to beat a diving Joe Root, he got a solid couple of hands to it but couldn't hold on and would have carried it over anyway
flick back to the bowler
another flick but this time chips it over the bowler, no-one at home at long off and gets four, great timing again, races away
length ball on the stumps, clipped down to long leg and they charge back for the second, superb running, McBren so quick
length ball just outside off, pushed to point
down the track and goes for a lofted off drive, doesn't get all of it and it teases Cook running back at mid-off, he dives and can only get a finger to it, very tough chance, if a chance at all
full of length on the off stump, hoiked to cow corner, powerful strike again
length back outside the off stump, pushed to backward point
full on the off stump, firmly pushed back to the bowler
full on the stumps, slapped down to long on
full toss on off stump, gently pushed to extra cover, rather tamely played from McBren
slower ball, on a length on off stump, Guptill gives himself room and hammers it over mid-off, another firm thump from Guptill
yorker and gets it in well, dug out down to long on
and Dernbach couldn't have bowled a ball that worse-suited his field, a full toss wide of off stump, smeared through cover point
McCullum charges and Dernbach bowls a slower ball and pushes gently down to long off
full and straight, driven down to long on, almost managing to decapitate Guptill
full and straight again, forced down to long on, Bairstow is in quickly to prevent the second
slower ball on the stumps and McBren gets down and slog sweeps it into the crowd over square leg, very well struck
goes for the yorker again, meets it on the full and gets it down to long on
full and just outside off, driven hard and down to long off, Trott slides and fumbles and, just, does he, yes, saves the four
excellent yorker, dug out through square leg and they end up getting two, rather unlucky that
full on the off stump, driven just wide enough to long off for a couple, very good running again
goes full on off stump again, meets it on the full and gets it wide of long off for another couple
slower ball, short just outside off, cut hard but only to the sweeper
back to full on the off stump, driven down to long on and two more brings the 300 up
slower ball on the stumps, pulled through square leg and Anderson can't get around in time to save from deep midwicket
full on the stumps, dug into midwicket for a single
full on off stump, a wild swing and gets a thick outside edge wide of short third man, deserves a bit of luck
full and straight again, this time gets a better connection but a worse result, finds long off

low full toss, hammered into the deep where Trott takes a great catch! Oh no he steps over the rope but gets rid of it, steps back inside the rope but has no idea where the ball is as he swivelled going over the boundary, the ball lands near the rope and has this gone for four in the end as Trott recovers? TV umpire checking and gives four, Trott nor Cook are happy with the call
full on off stump, slapped down to long off
full toss on off stump, swung into the leg side, out to Trott again, successfully fields this time
McCullum shuffling around on the crease, Anderson ends up sending down a leg stump half-volley and gets swung over cow corner, big strike and it's dropped on the terraces
full of length on middle and leg, clipped out to deep square leg
good yorker but no-one in the ring on the leg side so they get two more, very well ran again
low full toss, tapped down to long on, more hard running and another brace, the throw weren't the best
steps away and lifts a length ball over cover, well struck
leg stump full toss, long leg is up in the circle and they get four more
another full ball on leg stump, forced away fine and gets four more, a little unlucky but it's all running for New Zealand
full and straight, slapped over the bowler's head, great strike
full again, slaps this into the off side where extra cover saves well with the right-hand, does well
full outside off, swung off an edge down to long off so it runs slowly to the fielder and they get two more
full toss outside off, slapped down to wide third man, no-ball surely? It was definitely above waist height
wide of off stump, swung at and comes off a thick outside edge to fine third man, poor ball really, short of a length and well wide
full on the off stump, swung at and, oh, can you adam and eve it, squirts off a big inside edge and runs to fine leg for four

inn2.comm: length ball, decent bounce and carry as the ball leaves Cook a touch outside off, he carts it over deep midwicket like he's Viru leaves
pitched up, straighter line and blocked with a straight bat
slides down the leg side, as McClenaghan falls down in his follow through... He thought it flicked the pad
full and straight, clipped off the pads but straight to the square midwicket fielder
stays in the crease and jabs a length ball out towards point
slightly back of a length, outside off and punched off the back foot through the covers for a couple
fired in towards the pads and Cook tucks this one in front of square for a single
good length and a few inches outside off, shaping back in a wee bit and left alone
too wide this time, room for Cook to free the arms and bludgeon England's first boundary through point - you could almost see him licking his lips
tighter to the off, slightly back of a length, tapped defensively into the covers
pitched up on the pads, Cook flicks it wide of mid-on and they jog one
slightly full and drifting towards leg stump, steered through square leg for a couple
pitched up in the channel outside off and Bell punches crisply back to mid-off
too straight from McClenaghan and Cook tucks him through midwicket, this runs away across the glassy outfield for a few more
continues over the wicket to the right-hander, angled across and defended coming forward
length ball, pitching outside leg and rolling away behind square off the pad
shortish, outside the line of off and nipping back a touch, blocked to leg
bumper outside off and Cook takes it on, comes off somewhere near the bottom of the bat but there's enough on it to send the ball looping over midwicket for a couple
length ball on the stumps, played back to mid-on
stays back and defends around the line of off
takes the pace off and Bell misses attempting to drive
good length, around off and skidding on, deflected towards point
straightens his line and tapped short on the leg side
lovely stroke from Bell, picking up a full ball and spanking it straight back of the bowler's head with a flourish
length delivery in the channel and steered off the back foot towards third man
angled across and straightening, gets in line and defends
another McClenaghan bumper, over off stump and Bell hooks from in front of his face through deep square leg, its quickly across the outfield and fine leg can't cut it off

dropped but it would have been a superb grab at point... in the sort of batting form he's in, you'd have backed Guptill to snaffle it, the ball actually went into his hand, but Bell had hit it so hard it forced through the fingers and on to the turf even as McClenaghan was throwing up his arms in celebration
goes back and across and defends towards backward point this time
length ball, gets in line and blocks around off
skips forward, more dancing feet from Bell, tries to cross bat it through mid-on but doesn't connect properly
short and at the body, just a flick of the bat off his hips but it's right out of the screws and Cook gets four more to deep square leg
angled across on a length, tad wide and Cook thrashes a cut shot away but into the ground and to the man stationed at point
shortish and outside the line of off, pushed off the back foot into the off side
short and wide and again forced meatily off the back foot in front of square, McCullum makes good ground to his left but fails to stop the ball and thumps the ground
this is a blindingly good cover drive, slightly overpitched in the channel and Cook's hands flow through the shot like quicksilver to pierce the field and pick up four more
touch short and on the hips, Cook works it through square, they think about two but then snap out of it
angled across from over the wicket, Cook gets in line and defends
very full, almost yorker length outside off, punched square with an open bat face
pushed across on a full length again, Cook leaves this knowingly
overpitched and right under Cook's nose, little more than a check drive but it beats the dive of mid-off and skitters away - fifth boundary for the captain
back of a length and at the body, jabbed into a gap in front of midwicket
full length and sliding towards leg stump, it hits Bell on the back leg but Rob Bailey isn't interested in the appeal
still too full from Bracewell, drivable and punched wide of mid-off
bungs this one down the leg side
slightly back of a length, outside off and tapped into the covers
short again, Cook stands tall and drives off the back foot, again just a push but it bisects mid-on and mid-off for two more - that's the fifty up, from 45 balls
goes back and forces the ball towards mid-off
on the stumps, played from the crease towards mid-on
very full and wide, Cook swings lustily across the line and gets a bottom edge into the pitch, Mills colllects in his follow through

sneaked through and bowled him! The extra delivery pays dividends, Cook caught on the crease, there was a gap between bat and pad and the ball perhaps nibbled back a touch, clattering into the top of middle and off. The length was good, Cook possibly could have been forward and it might have kept a touch lower than he expected - NZ don't care about any of that
on the stumps, worked through backward square for a couple
stands tall and cracks one into the covers of the back foot, well stopped
short, at the man and rapped through midwicket on the pull, that sort of delivery is not going to tax Bell much
gets across and dabs into the on side
shortish and played towards mid-off off the back foot
slightly full but driven on the up, Bell getting forward and just clearing Bracewell in his follow through, it goes fine of mid-off and they run hard for three
back of a length and around the line of off, defended
length ball in the channel outside off, Bell cuts straight to the man at point
Bell waltzes out and lifts Mills back down the ground, he misread the length, it wasn't at all full and the shot wasn't middled but he was confident enough in the stroke to follow through with it
fuller, angled in towards off stump and maybe a touch slower, blocked
gets across and defends a length ball towards mid-off
dug in short and Bell gets forward, drops the ball short towards midwicket, there's not a run... until they're granted an overthrow
is this a miss? No, didn't quite carry to extra cover, who was diving forward but couldn't quite get there
gets across and blocks a length ball this time

attacks again, dancing out of the crease but this time Bell screws up, the ball looping gently to mid-off! Bracewell perhaps saw him coming, the length wasn't quite hittable and the ball ballooned towards the edge of the circle. There'll be no Bell ton today
stays back and tapped defensively into the covers
sliding down the leg side, maybe scrapes the pad on the way through
good length, angled in towards middle and leg, blocked towards midwicket - maiden, and a fair one too
length ball on the stumps, tapped into the midwicket area
in the corridor, length ball and Trott comes forward to defend towards cover
slightly short and wide, tries to whip the hands through a cut shot but can't get the bat speed and point cuts it off
goes across and works a length ball into the midwicket region
probing line from Mills, giving nothing away, Trott gets forward and blocks to cover
touch wide and Trott steers a back-of-a-length ball down to third man to get off the mark. He's started with a steady strike rate of 16.66
slightly full and pitching around middle stump, walks across and tucks a couple in front of deep midwicket
length ball, wide of the off stump, tries to manufacture a shot and gets an inside edge
pitched up in the channel and pushed towards mid-off
drops shorts, Trott seems to pick it up late but rolls his wrists and drags through square leg
Root gets away with this, playing across the line and top-edging hiiiiiiiiiigggggghhhhhh towards long leg but the fielder can't get there and he gets a couple of runs into the bargain
pitched up and nudged back down the pitch
tossed up and worked through the leg side coming forward
full and around middle stump, Root is quickly down on one knee to sweep flat to the man at deep midwicket
pushed through wide of the off stump, gets forward and blocks
hangs back this time and waits on a length ball, steering it wide of short third man
nearly yorks himself here, skipping forward and missing the ball as it squirts through under the bat, bouncing up into Ronchi's forearm and away - was a stumping chance too
drops short and Root swats across the line out towards deep backward square, where McCullum has plenty of cover
pitched up in the channel and defended
length ball, goes across and turns to midwicket
bit of width, Trott backs away and chops a cut shot out through the infield to the sweeper
length ball in the corridor, driven on the up, into the ground and over cover for a single
little bit sparky from Trott, backing away and uppercutting over gully towards third man, just a single though
full and wide and Root drives with an open bat fat, slicing it low through backward point for a couple more
goes to sweep from outside off stump and gets a bottom edge into the keeper's pad
pushed at hard again, gets to midwicket
step down the wicket and tucked down to long on
hangs back and dabs past backward point, they get a couple
back again, this time playing a straighter ball through midwicket and a slight fumble allows them a second
tries to stay in the crease and play to leg again, tucks to midwicket
full and just outside off, Trott tries to give himself room but ends up stretching for it and misses
flicked from middle and leg down in between long leg and deep square
length just outside off, dabbed down to third man, the fielder does well and saves the second
Root tries to play a tighter ball into the same region and pushes to point
fuller ball, driven without too much foot movement to the right of mid on for a single
length outside off, dabbed off a bottom edge to third man
full on the leg stump, clipped out to deep square leg
swept hard from outside off and in the air and is this dropped again by Guptill? It is. Both chances that have been blasted at him and he went with one hand
played forward just outside off and well saved by midwicket

comes down the track and misses, easy stumping but fumbled, a missed stumping and a terrible miss too, awful work from Ronchi. Had so much time to remove the bails but totally lost the ball and Trott was able to slide his bat back in
full ball driven to midwicket
bit of width outside off and this is late cut for four, very nicely played
length ball down the leg side and not given a wide? Are you sure Rob Bailey? He isn't sure and after a delay signals wide
same length but on the stumps, Root paddles it down to long leg, chase round for deep square
little short and pulled hard out to midwicket, brings the hundred up
back and across the off stump, tucked into square leg and they take a quick single
Root shaped to paddle sweep but the delivery was well outside off and Root adjusts and dabs it down to third man, well adjusted from bowler and batsman
tucked off the hip through square leg
waited for and a length ball hammered through cover to the sweeper
a shimmy down the wicket and clip down to long on
stays in the crease and tucks to midwicket
plays forward this time and finds midwicket again
length ball flicked off the pads to deep square leg
slightly short, Root rocks back and cuts hard but only finds extra cover
now takes the fielders out of the equation with a lofted drive over extra cover, a touch wide and struck well
rub your eyes, what is this! A lofted drive for six by Jonathan Trott! Only his third in his ODI career and first since 2011. A beautiful strike through the line, right over the bowler's head
back of a length and pulled without timing just wide of mid on for a single
back and dabbed to point from off stump
full just outside off, ran out to the sweeper on the cover rope
driven with the angle on the front foot but can't beat extra cover
driven again, only finds extra cover again
goes for a slog from outside off and gets a wild outside edge that runs down to third man, horrible shot
back and pushed to midwicket, just isn't rotating the strike easily enough is Trott
just outside off, dabbed just behind backward point for a single

down the wicket and goes for a lofted on-drive, doesn't get into it properly and finds long on. Once again and England batsman gets going and then gets out, New Zealand strike to stymie any progress again. Root tried to clear the ropes from a ball tossed up on middle and off but he got it low on the bat I think and the catch was straightforward for the fielder running a few yards to his left
ball on the stumps, pushed to midwicket on the back foot
stays back and this time clips down to long on
back of a length, Trott gets inside the line and clips down to long leg
short and miles wide of off stump
short and well wide again outside off, ignored again and this is just inside the guidelines
short again outside off, slapped up and over the infield but only finds the cover sweeper
short again, gets inside it again and finds long leg, again
full this time and well outside off, Morgan reaches out for it and digs it into the covers
full toss on the off stump, pushed to cover
back of a length, clipped through square leg, they get a couple between fielders
outside off, driven into the covers and very well saved
clipped off the pads trough square leg again, just one this time, too close to deep backward square for the second
up and over mid-off for four, nice stoke, picked up well from just outside off stump
paddle swept from outside off down to long leg, chase around for deep backward square
and again but this time doesn't get it fine enough for the second
back of a length on off stump, blocked back up the wicket
width offered and slapped hard through cover but again, straight to the sweeper, heavily defended that off side
short, hooked from off stump, gets it, not quite between fielders for four, deep midwicket comes around and saves two more
length ball now, Trott across his stumps and pushes to long on
back of a length angled in to the body, tucked to the left of midwicket
short and wide, might have been a wide if he'd have left it but Trott slashes at it and finds deep cover point
full length on off stump, flicked down to long on
flat delivery on off stump, cut to backward point
another flat delivery, 59mph, drives to extra cover
a touch short, hangs back and punches hard past extra cover, well placed
comes forward now and fiddles it backward point
full on the stumps, pressed down to long off
back of a length just outside off, pushed to point
back of a length, cut out through point
half-volley just outside off but Trott can only drive to mid-off
another driveable ball but Trott can only find extra-cover this time, in fact he misfields so they do take a single but that's two hittable balls that Trott didn't get into at all
little straight for the left-hander, flicked down to long leg
there we go Trotty, steps down and thwack, nearly takes the bowler's head off with a powerful straight drive, gave himself a little room and struck it sweetly
length ball, Morgan gets leg side of it and pushed through cover
tries to stay inside it and back cuts, only finds short third man
flat delivery, pushed into the on side, bowler and midwicket save the single
a little fuller and driven down to long on
cut hard and it comes off a top edge but he finds the gap in front of point, Morgan dropped back and didn't get the cut stroke right at all
back and pushed through midwicket
length ball, clipped to midwicket
pushed from just outside off to mid off, always takes that extra ball to get off strike Trott
Morgan with a step down the wicket and goes to cut, Franklin saw him and bowled a slower ball, Morgan adjusted and forced to backward point
a loose drive outside off, comes off an outside edge and gets it down to third man
full length on leg stump, clipped over the on side but not past the sweeper
full ball just outside off, dug towards point and that takes Trott to fifty
forward and blocked in front of point for a single

slower ball outside off, 55mph, Morgan tries a huge slog from outside off and nicks it to the keeper what a bonus wicket for New Zealand. What is Morgan doing trying to blast away the very first ball he's seen from Elliot? Totally done by the change of pace, through with the shot way to soon and get a thin top edge that is solidly held by Ronchi. Inspired move from Brendon McCullum
back of a length pushed through point
full ball, driven back to the bowler
length ball whipped through midwicket
full on leg stump, clipped down to long leg

and this might seal the deal, driven on the up and taken at short extra cover Buttler driving from just outside off without getting his foot right across to the pitch, chipping it in the air and Guptill, third time lucky, dives forward and takes the chance with two hands
length just outside off, Woakes goes to cut and chops it down into the ground, Trott calls him through for a quick single
leg side wide
length ball just outside off, dropped to backward point
full ball just outside off, driven to point
back of a length, Trott gives himself room and cuts hard and almost finds deep cover, ball lands a couple of yards in front of him
length ball into the pads, blocked going back and across
full length on middle and leg, clipped wide of backward square
now pulled backward of square, just another couple though as the fielder does well sliding to his right
fuller, played to midwicket
hint of width just outside off stump, dabbed past backward point and they get three well ran
length just outside off, dabbed to point and they take a quick run
full and wide of off, not for the first time Trott can't pierce the infield on the drive but does get a single wide of mid-off
very full and wide of the stumps, Trott flat bats it into the ground and through to the keeper
oh Mitchell, he's overstepped in delivering a leg-stump ball that Trott tucked off his pads - free hit coming up
good response from the bowler, fixing his own mess, full and wide and squeezed out towards cover
length delivery, comes forward outside off and pushes through a gap
angled across on a length and left!!!!!
fullish length and pushed across, punched into a gap in the covers
dug in short, Trott is quickly back and rolls the wrists on a pull shot that picks out deep backward square
pushed through around off stump and driven back down the ground
spinning in from outside off, worked off the back foot towards mid-on
uses his feet and gets to the pitch, drives the ball to long-on
length ball, on the pads, worked through midwicket
tossed up, Woakes gets forward and defends back to the bowler
full and slightly wide, skips forward and pushes a single through the covers to the sweeper
Trott leaves the crease as Franklin drops short and scoops the ball perilously close to the man on the 45 for a single
pushed across on a length, opens the face and steers one to short third man
bit of tap from Trott, actually quite surprising to see him muscle a short ball over deep midwicket, gets hold of it all right though for a one-bounce four
pitched up a bit more, around the line of off, pushed into the covers
full and straight and Trott on-drives down the ground to bring up the England 200. They're not raising the white flag yet
sprayed across outside off stump and Woakes swings hard, gets a thick outside edge and beats the man on the edge of the circle to run away for another boundary
tossed up outside off stump, Woakes gives him the charge lofts over extra cover into the vacant outfield, doesn't quite go all the way
pushed through on leg stump, worked off the pads through midwicket
steps back and then comes forward and punches a full ball down the ground to long-on
gets forward and works the ball wide of long-on, they run hard for two
pushed through, on the stumps and nurdled into the leg side

comes down the track, drifts past the bat and he's well out of his ground as Ronchi completes the stumping - that's all, Woakes! Think the bowler saw him coming, dragged it wide and there was no turn, skidded through to the keeper and this time he finishes the job without any alarums
length ball speared down the leg side, clipped in front of backward square leg for one
length delivery outside off, stands stock still and throws the wrists, misses everything

hit on the pad, big appeal from Mills... but Bresnan has been run out anyway by the diving Williamson from backward point! Mills went full and straight, was probably missing leg and Bresnan set off without really clocking where the ball had gone, Trott sent him back but as he laboured to return to his ground a terrific bit of work from Williamson beat him to it
back of a length, tapped defensively into the leg side
full and straight, hit on the pad but missing again, according to the umpire
length ball on the stumps, worked unobtrusively through square leg for a couple more
tossed up on the stumps, clipped firmly wide of mid-on
tossed up, on middle, waits in the crease and turns to leg
nearly a caught and bowled chance, as Swann chips just short of Williamson

tossed up and Swann has dragged on! He's furious with himself, having given Williamson a second with his part-time offspin. It was full and wide, Swann tried to give it a whack in orthodox fashion but simply deflected the ball on to his wicket
round the wicket, tossed up on off stump and gripping a touch, solid forward defensive
pushed across, Anderson flips this round the corner for a single
opens the face and guides into the covers, Trott wants one but is sent back and a direct hit would have done for him
back of a length, on the hips and flicked aerially over square leg, vacant area of the pitch and Anderson keeps the strike
back of a length and fired across the bows, Anderson fiddles and misses
stays in the crease, opens the face and guides a single to third man
full and straight, rolls the fingers over a slower ball, Trott lofts over midwicket, into a gap but a diving stop prevents four
bit of width, Trott skips forward and has a slash, gets a thick edge over backward point and again it will run away because of the Powerplay restrictions
on middle and leg, leans out and nudges one through midwicket
drops a little short, pulls flat through midwicket for another single
tossed up wide of the stumps, goes down on one knee and swats a flat sweep through square leg
floated up on middle and leg, punched to long-on for a single
flowing cover drive - maybe it is Lara after all - skipping out to meet the ball on the full and forcing it past extra cover and away
length ball, straightening around off, goes back and hacks one square
stays back and cuts to point, sharp single and they just make it
length ball, whipped through midwicket, they push hard for a second and Trott gets back
skips forward, Mills gets it up in the blockhole and Trott jams down on it, the ball stops almost dead and they pinch one anyway
fired across on a length, Anderson opens the shoulders and attempts to cut, gets an edge, maybe off the toe, down to third man
length ball, backs away and swings the ball back towards mid-on, who's on the edge of the circle
pitched up, heading towards leg stump, glanced off the pads, the fielder has to come running in and fails to collect first time
length ball, not that short but wide enough for Anderson to slap through backward point for four more
angled across and steered through square with an angled bat
pitched up straight, on the stumps, scuffed towards mid-on and with the field back they're able to punch two
goes full again, around off stump, chops down on the ball behind square and there it is - Trott's fourth ODI ton and from 98 balls too
width again, Anderson has a happy slap and thick edges to third man again, Kyle Mills lumbers round but is sprawled like a sealion over the boundary rope by the time he stops it
dug in short, room to swing it over backward point this time, firm connection and it beats Mills on the other side this time - those two boundaries have taken Anderson to his highest ODI score
pushed into the covers, they head back for a second and the throw nearly decapitates McClenaghan at the non-striker's end
length deliver, dribbled short into the covers for a single
oof, how did that miss? Searching for the yorker, Anderson swung and missed and the ball passed a fraction wide of off stump

McClenaghan hits this time, full and straight and back goes middle! Good bowling to a tailender, pitched up and tailing in towards the wicket as Anderson made room, sneaked under the bat and physics did the rest
round the wicket but too full, not quite the yorker, outside off and punched to mid-off
pitched up again, in the channel and driven towards cover
full and straight but you can't fool Trotty, he pings it through the covers off the back foot, beating the man on the circle for a couple
on the stumps, pretty much a low full toss, clubbed through midwicket
goes for the yorker again, Dernbach steps away and swings late, manages to squeeze to through point
pitched up around middle, Trott hacks the ball back down the ground
again steps away and drags a full-length ball back past the bowler to long-on
length ball, wide of the stumps, carved high over point for a couple

hoicked into the off side, Dernbach trying to put the ball into orbit and getting it almost as far as the circle, where mid-off nearly misjudges it, probably from looking away over the horizon, before flopping forward to take the decisive catch and confirm an 86-run win for New Zealand
